headline: Missed Out on Nvidia? Buy This Magnificent Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Before It Soars at Least 43% in 2025.
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) has helped Nvidia's (NASDAQ: NVDA) stock clock stellar gains in 2024, with shares of the semiconductor giant rising more than 183% as of this writing, but it seems that investors are now having doubts about the company's ability to maintain its stunning growth rate over the long run.  This is probably why Nvidia stock has retreated despite delivering better-than-expected numbers and guidance last month.  The company's revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 increased an impressive 94% from the year-ago period to $35.1 billion, while earnings jumped 103% year over year to $0.81 per share.

raw.headline: Missed Out on Nvidia? Buy This Magnificent Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock Before It Soars at Least 43% in 2025.

This is probably why Nvidia stock has retreated despite delivering better-than-expected numbers and guidance last month.  The company's revenue for the third quarter of fiscal 2025 increased an impressive 94% from the year-ago period to $35.1 billion, while earnings jumped 103% year over year to $0.81 per share.

headline: 2 AI Stocks to Buy in December and Hold for 20 Years
summary: Every decade seems to create a new wave of growth stocks that benefit from the latest trends in the economy.  The last 20 years have created tremendous wealth for investors who jumped early on the growth of e-commerce (Amazon), streaming video (Netflix), and electric cars (Tesla).  Artificial intelligence (AI) has the makings of the next wealth-building opportunity in the stock market.

headline: 1 Index Fund to Buy That May Beat the S&P 500 by 240% in the Next Decade, According to Certain Wall Street Analysts
summary: Analysts at Goldman Sachs recently published a gloomy 10-year outlook for the S&P 500 (SNPINDEX: ^GSPC).  The Goldman analysts highlighted two reasons they expect that the benchmark index is due for a dismal decade: elevated valuations and "market concentration that currently ranks near the highest level in 100 years."  Investors cannot change the valuations of the stocks that comprise the S&P 500, but they can buy an equal-weight index fund, which sidesteps the concentration problem.

raw.headline: 1 Index Fund to Buy That May Beat the S&P 500 by 240% in the Next Decade, According to Certain Wall Street Analysts

Investors cannot change the valuations of the stocks that comprise the S&P 500, but they can buy an equal-weight index fund, which sidesteps the concentration problem.

headline: The Boring Trade Is On: Billionaires Are Paring Their Positions in AI Stocks Like Nvidia and Palantir and Piling Into a Sector the Market Left for Dead for 2 Years
summary: This typically involves buying bad companies at great valuations, selling great companies at bad valuations, or buying wonderful companies at fair prices.  This theme seemed to play out in the third quarter of the year, as billionaires running large funds started to move out of high-flying artificial intelligence stocks like Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) and Palantir (NASDAQ: PLTR) and into more traditional sectors that are admittedly quite boring compared to AI and high-growth tech.  Billionaire investors even piled into a sector that investors have -- until recently -- ignored amid a two-year bull market.
